<td class="ajt" style="width:26%">
<p class="ces">Earnings multiples are applied to the earnings of the company to determine the enterprise value</p>
<p class="ces"> </p>
<p class="ceq">Earnings multiples</p>
<p class="ces">When selecting earnings multiple, we consider:</p>
<p class="ceu">1.  Comparable listed companies' current performance and through the cycle averages.</p>
<p class="cev">2.  Relevant market transaction multiples.</p>
<p class="cew">3.  Exit expectations and other company specific factors</p>
<p class="ces">For point 1 and 2 of the above we select companies in the same industry and, where possible, with a similar business model and profile in terms of size, products, services and customers, growth rates and geographic focus.</p>
<p class="ces"> </p>
<p class="ces">The pre-discount multiple ranges from 8.5x-19.5x (31 March 2021: 8.5x - 19.5x).</p>
<p class="cer"> </p>

<p class="cez"> </p>
<p class="ceq">Earnings</p>
<p class="cez">Reported earnings are adjusted for non-recurring items, such as restructuring expenses, for significant corporate actions and, in exceptional cases, run-rate adjustments to arrive at maintainable earnings.<br/>
<br/>
The most common measure is earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortisation ("EBITDA").<br/>
<br/>
Earnings are usually obtained from portfolio company management accounts to the preceding quarter end, with reference also to forecast earnings and the maintainable view of earnings.<br/>
<br/>
Action, our largest asset, we value using run-rate earnings.</p>

<p class="cbr"><span class="cbe">Investments</span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span class="cbe">The Group makes investments in the equity of unquoted and quoted investments where it does not have control but may be able to participate in the financial and operating policies of that company. IFRS presumes that it is possible to exert significant influence when the equity holding is greater than 20%. The Group has taken the investment entity exception as permitted by IFRS 10 and has not equity accounted for these investments, in accordance with IAS 28, but they are related parties. The total amounts included for investments where the Group has significant influence but not control are as follows:</span></p>

<p class="cbk"><span class="car">Statement of Directors' responsibilities</span></p>
<p class="ccx"><span class="cay"> </span></p>
<p class="cck"><span class="cbe">The Directors, who are required to prepare the financial statements on a going concern basis unless it is not appropriate,</span><span class="cbe"> are satisfied that the Group has the resources to continue in business for the foreseeable future. In making this assessment, the Directors have considered information relating to present and future conditions, including future projections of profitability and cash flows</span><span class="cbe">.</span></p>
<p class="cck"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cck"><span class="cbe">The Directors confirm that to the best of their knowledge:</span></p>
<p class="cck"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cfu"><span class="cbe">a)  the condensed set of financial statements has been prepared in accordance with IAS 34 "Interim Financial Reporting" as adopted for use in the UK; and</span></p>
<p class="cfv"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cfu"><span class="cbe">b)  the Half-year report includes a fair review of the information required by:</span></p>

<p class="cbk"><span class="car">Independent review report to 3i Group plc </span></p>
<p class="cbt"><span class="car"> </span></p>
<p class="cbr"><span class="cbg">Conclusion </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbo"><span class="cbe">We have been engaged by the Company to review the condensed set of financial statements in the half-yearly financial report for the six months ended 30 September 2021 which comprises the Condensed consolidated statement of comprehensive income, the Condensed consolidated statement of financial position, the Condensed consolidated statement of changes in equity, the Condensed consolidated cash flow statement and the related explanatory notes. </span></p>
<p class="cbo"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbo"><span class="cbe">Based on our review, nothing has come to our attention that causes us to believe that the condensed set of financial statements in the half-yearly financial report for the six months ended 30 September 2021 is not prepared, in all material respects, in accordance with UK adopted international accounting standards and the Disclosure Guidance and Transparency Rules ("the DTR") of the UK's Financial Conduct Authority ("the UK FCA"). </span></p>
<p class="cbo"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbr"><span class="cbg">Scope of review </span></p>
<p class="cfx"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbo"><span class="cbe">We conducted our review in accordance with International Standard on Review Engagements (UK and Ireland) 2410 Review of Interim Financial Information Performed by the Independent Auditor of the Entity issued by the Auditing Practices Board for use in the UK. A review of interim financial information consists of making enquiries, primarily of persons responsible for financial and accounting matters, and applying analytical and other review procedures. We read the other information contained in the half-yearly financial report and consider whether it contains any apparent misstatements or material inconsistencies with the information in the condensed set of financial statements. </span></p>
<p class="cbo"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbo"><span class="cbe">A review is substantially less in scope than an audit conducted in accordance with International Standards on Auditing (UK) and consequently does not enable us to obtain assurance that we would become aware of all significant matters that might be identified in an audit. Accordingly, we do not express an audit opinion. </span></p>
<p class="cbo"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbr"><span class="cbg">Directors' Responsibilities </span></p>
<p class="cfx"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbo"><span class="cbe">The half-yearly financial report is the responsibility of, and has been approved by, the directors. The directors are responsible for preparing the half-yearly financial report in accordance with the DTR of the UK FCA. </span></p>
<p class="cbo"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbo"><span class="cbe">As disclosed in 'Basis of preparation and accounting policies', the annual financial statements of the group are prepared in accordance with UK adopted international accounting standards. The directors are responsible for preparing the condensed set of financial statements included in the half-yearly financial report in accordance with IAS 34 as adopted for use in UK. </span></p>
<p class="cbo"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbr"><span class="cbg">Our Responsibility </span></p>
<p class="cfx"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbo"><span class="cbe">Our responsibility is to express to the company a conclusion on the condensed set of financial statements in the half-yearly financial report based on our review. </span></p>
<p class="cbo"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbr"><span class="cbg">The purpose of our review work and to whom we owe our responsibilities</span></p>
<p class="cfy"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cfy"><span class="cbe">This report is made solely to the company in accordance with the terms of our engagement to assist the company in meeting the requirements of the DTR of the UK FCA. Our review has been undertaken so that we might state to the company those matters we are required to state to it in this report and for no other purpose. To the fullest extent permitted by law, we do not accept or assume responsibility to anyone other than the company for our review work, for this report, or for the conclusions we have reached.</span></p>

<p class="cbr"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">2013-2016 vintage</span></span><span class="cbe"> includes Aspen Pumps, Audley Travel, Basic-Fit, Dynatect, Kinolt, ATESTEO, JMJ, Q Holding, WP, Scandlines further (completed in December 2013), Christ, Geka, Óticas Carol and Blue Interactive.</span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">2016-2019 vintage</span></span><span class="cbe"> includes BoConcept, Cirtec Medical, Formel D, Hans Anders, arrivia, Luqom, Magnitude Software, Havea, Royal Sanders and Schlemmer. </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">2019-2022 vintage</span></span><span class="cbe"> includes Evernex, SaniSure, GartenHaus, MPM, WilsonHCG, ten23 Health and MAIT.</span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Approved Investment Trust Company</span></span><span class="cbe"> This is a particular UK tax status maintained by 3i Group plc, the parent company of 3i Group. An approved Investment Trust company is a UK company which meets certain conditions set out in the UK tax rules which include a requirement for the company to undertake portfolio investment activity that aims to spread investment risk and for the company's shares to be listed on an approved exchange. The "approved" status for an investment trust must be agreed by the UK tax authorities and its benefit is that certain profits of the company, principally its capital profits, are not taxable in the UK. </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Assets under management ("AUM")</span></span><span class="cbe"> A measure of the total assets that 3i has to invest or manages on behalf of shareholders and third-party investors for which it receives a fee. AUM is measured at fair value. In the absence of a third-party fund in Private Equity, it is not a measure of fee generating capability.</span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Board</span></span><span class="cbe"> The board of Directors of the Company.</span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Buyouts 2010-2012 vintage</span></span><span class="cbe"> includes Action, Amor, Element, Etanco, Hilite, OneMed and Trescal.</span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Capital redemption reserve</span></span><span class="cbe"> is established in respect of the redemption of the Company's ordinary shares.</span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Capital reserve</span></span><span class="cbe"> recognises all profits that are capital in nature or have been allocated to capital. Following changes to the Companies Act, the Company amended its Articles of Association at the 2012 Annual General Meeting to allow these profits to be distributable by way of a dividend.</span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Carried interest payable</span></span><span class="cbe"> is accrued on the realised and unrealised profits generated taking relevant performance hurdles into consideration, assuming all investments were realised at the prevailing book value. Carried interest is only actually paid when the relevant performance hurdles are met and the accrual is discounted to reflect expected payment periods. </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Carried interest receivable</span></span><span class="cbe"> The Group earns a share of profits from funds which it manages on behalf of third parties. These profits are earned when the funds meet certain performance conditions and are paid by the fund once these conditions have been met on a cash basis. The carried interest receivable may be subject to clawback provisions if the performance of the fund deteriorates following carried interest being paid. </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Company</span></span><span class="cbe"> 3i Group plc.</span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">DACH</span></span> <span class="cbe">The region covering Austria, Germany and Switzerland.</span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Discounting</span></span><span class="cbe"> The reduction in present value at a given date of a future cash transaction at an assumed rate, using a discount factor reflecting the time value of money. </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">EBITDA</span></span><span class="cbe"> is defined as earnings before interest, taxation, depreciation and amortisation and is used as the typical measure of portfolio company performance.</span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">EBITDA multiple</span></span><span class="cbe"> Calculated as the enterprise value over EBITDA, it is used to determine the value of a company.</span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Fair value movements on investment entity subsidiaries</span></span><span class="cbe"> The movement in the carrying value of Group subsidiaries, classified as investment entities under IFRS 10, between the start and end of the accounting period converted into sterling using the exchange rates at the date of the movement.</span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Fair value through profit or loss ("FVTPL")</span></span><span class="cbe"> is an IFRS measurement basis permitted for assets and liabilities which meet certain criteria. Gains and losses on assets and liabilities measured as FVTPL are recognised directly in the Statement of comprehensive income.</span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Fee income (or Fees receivable)</span></span><span class="cbe"> is earned for providing services to 3i's portfolio companies and predominantly falls into one of two categories. Negotiation and other transaction fees are earned for providing transaction related services. Monitoring and other ongoing service fees are earned for providing a range of services over a period of time. </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Fees receivable from external funds</span></span><span class="cbe"> Fees receivable from external funds are earned for providing management and advisory services to a variety of fund partnerships and other entities. Fees are typically calculated as a percentage of the cost or value of the assets managed during the year and are paid quarterly, based on the assets under management to date.</span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Foreign exchange on investments</span></span><span class="cbe"> arises on investments made in currencies that are different from the functional currency of the Group entity. Investments are translated at the exchange rate ruling at the date of the transaction. At each subsequent reporting date investments are translated to sterling at the exchange rate ruling at that date. </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Gross investment return ("GIR")</span></span><span class="cbe"> includes profit and loss on realisations, increases and decreases in the value of the investments we hold at the end of a period, any income received from the investments such as interest, dividends and fee income, movements in the fair value of derivatives and foreign exchange movements. GIR is measured as a percentage of the opening portfolio value.</span></p>
<p class="cbk"> </p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Growth 2010-2012 vintage</span></span><span class="cbe"> includes Element, Hilite, BVG, Go Outdoors, Loxam, Touchtunes and WFCI.</span></p>
<p class="cbk"> </p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Interest income from investment portfolio</span></span><span class="cbe"> is recognised as it accrues. When the fair value of an investment is assessed to be below the principal value of a loan, the Group recognises a provision against any interest accrued from the date of the assessment going forward until the investment is assessed to have recovered in value.</span></p>
<p class="cbk"> </p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">International Financial Reporting Standards ("IFRS")</span></span> <span class="cbe">are accounting standards issued by the International Accounting Standards Board ("IASB"). The Group's consolidated financial statements are required to be prepared in accordance with IFRS.</span></p>
<p class="cbk"> </p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Investment basis</span></span><span class="cbe"> Accounts prepared assuming that IFRS 10 had not been introduced. Under this basis, we fair value portfolio companies at the level we believe provides the most comprehensive financial information. </span></p>
<p class="cbk"> </p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">IRR</span></span><span class="cas"> Internal Rate of Return.</span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Key Performance Indicator ("KPI")</span></span><span class="cbe"> is a measure by reference to which the development, performance or position of the Group can be measured effectively.</span></p>
<p class="cbk"> </p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Like-for-like</span></span><span class="cbe"> </span><span class="adr"><a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/dictionary/english/figure" data-type="url" class="tr-link" translate="no">figures</a></span><span class="cbe"> </span><span class="adr"><a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/dictionary/english/compare" data-type="url" class="tr-link" translate="no">compare</a></span><span class="cbe"> </span><span class="adr"><a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/dictionary/english/finance" data-type="url" class="tr-link" translate="no">financial</a></span><span class="cbe"> </span><span class="adr"><a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/dictionary/english/result" data-type="url" class="tr-link" translate="no">results</a></span><span class="cbe"> in one </span><span class="adq"><a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/dictionary/english/period" data-type="url" class="tr-link" translate="no">period</a></span><span class="cbe"> with those for the </span><span class="adr"><a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/dictionary/english/previous" data-type="url" class="tr-link" translate="no">previous</a></span><span class="cbe"> </span><span class="adq"><a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/dictionary/english/period" data-type="url" class="tr-link" translate="no">perio</a></span><span class="cbe">d.</span></p>
<p class="cbk"> </p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Money multiple</span></span><span class="cbe"> is calculated as the cumulative distributions plus any residual value divided by paid-in capital. </span></p>
<p class="cbk"> </p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Net asset value ("NAV")</span></span><span class="cbe"> is a measure of the fair value of our proprietary investments and the net costs of operating the business. </span></p>
<p class="cbk"> </p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Operating cash profit/loss </span></span><span class="cbe">is the difference between our cash income (consisting of portfolio interest received, portfolio dividends received, portfolio fees received and fees received from external funds as per the Investment basis Consolidated cash flow statement) and our operating expenses and lease payments (as per the Investment basis Consolidated cash flow statement).</span></p>
<p class="cbk"> </p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Operating profit</span></span><span class="cbe"> includes gross investment return, management fee income generated from managing external funds, the costs of running our business, net interest payable, other losses and carried interest. </span></p>
<p class="cbk"> </p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Organic growth</span></span><span class="cbe"> is the growth a company achieves by increasing output and enhancing sales internally.</span></p>
<p class="cbk"> </p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Performance fee receivable</span></span><span class="cbe"> The Group earns a performance fee from the investment management services it provides to 3i Infrastructure plc ("3iN") when 3iN's total return for the year exceeds a specified threshold. This fee is calculated on an annual basis and paid in cash early in the next financial year.</span></p>
<p class="cbk"> </p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Portfolio income</span></span><span class="cbe"> is that which is directly related to the return from individual investments. It is comprised of dividend income, income from loans and receivables and fee income. </span></p>
<p class="cbk"> </p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Proprietary Capital</span></span><span class="cbe"> Shareholders' capital which is available to invest to generate profits.</span></p>
<p class="cbk"> </p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Realised profits or losses over value on the disposal of investments</span></span><span class="cbe"> The difference between the fair value of the consideration received, less any directly attributable costs, on the sale of equity and the repayment of loans and receivables and its carrying value at the start of the accounting period, converted into sterling using the exchange rates at the date of disposal.</span></p>
<p class="cbr"> </p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Revenue reserve</span></span><span class="cbe"> recognises all profits that are revenue in nature or have been allocated to revenue.</span></p>
<p class="cbk"> </p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Segmental reporting</span></span><span class="cbe"> Operating segments are reported in a manner consistent with the internal reporting provided to the Chief Executive who is considered to be the Group's chief operating decision maker. All transactions between business segments are conducted on an arm's length basis, with intrasegment revenue and costs being eliminated on consolidation. Income and expenses directly associated with each segment are included in determining business segment performance.</span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Share-based payment reserve</span></span><span class="cbe"> is a reserve to recognise those amounts in retained earnings in respect of share-based payments.</span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Syndication</span></span><span class="cbe"> The sale of part of our investment in a portfolio company to a third party, usually within 12 months of our initial investment and for the purposes of facilitating investment by a co-investor or portfolio company management in line with our original investment plan. A syndication is treated as a negative investment rather than a realisation.</span></p>
<p class="cbk"> </p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Total return</span></span><span class="cbe"> comprises of operating profit less tax charge less movement in actuarial valuation of the historic defined benefit pension scheme. </span></p>
<p class="cbk"> </p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Total shareholder return ("TSR")</span></span><span class="cbe"> is the measure of the overall return to shareholders and includes the movement in the share price and any dividends paid, assuming that all dividends are reinvested on their ex</span><span class="adp">‑</span><span class="cbe">dividend date. </span></p>
<p class="cbk"> </p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Translation reserve</span></span><span class="cbe"> comprises all exchange differences arising from the translation of the financial statements of international operations. </span></p>
<p class="cbr"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span style="font-weight:bold"><span class="cbe">Unrealised profits or losses on the revaluation of investments</span></span><span class="cbe"> The movement in the carrying value of investments between the start and end of the accounting period converted into sterling using the exchange rates at the date of the movement. </span></p>
<p class="cbk"><span class="cbe"> </span></p>
<p class="cbr"><span class="caz"> </span></p>
<p class="cbr"><span class="caz"> </span></p>
